reviewText: I bought this for my husband, which he loves it. So guys guess that says it all. To me it's sort of a silly western. You can watch this with the family and it's good over bad guys. So that's important, but the acting is so-so and the story is the same. But if you have good memories of this movie , then buy it, my husband likes it and has played it twice already. Service with the company was great!

OMG!!  I can't believe this film has actually come out on DVD.  I have looked out for it for years.  It is one of my all time favourite films.  I was able to copy it to DVD from the video some time ago but to have an actual copy of the film is fantastic.

I have always enjoy Jeff Osterhage's cowboy films (The Sacketts, The Shadow Riders) and this one is no exception.  It has so many elements to it.  Not least the way Jeff's character John is a cross between Luke Skywalker and the Lone Ranger.  He is trained to use his 'instincts' like the force and become a force for good.  Hal Holbrook is excellent as his mentor who has a secret of his own.

I would recommend anyone to buy this film and just immerse yourself in how westerns used to be made.  I don't think you will be disappointed.
The only reason for this movie (a TV pilot) to exist is to watch Kier Dullea do Custer doing MacArthur.
tipacal 70s movie cheezy.jeffery osterhage is a better cowboy than this.will not watch this movie again.goingto bury it in my backyard
I received it really fast and the dvd played with no problems. it brought back memories from when I watched it on tv many years ago. the movie was still great to watch.
Watched on tv last night,Awesome movie.
Got for a gift for my husband for Christmas. He was more than thrilled to finally own this movie on DVD
It played on one of two computers, and a blueray player. Disk quality was good.
thank you for getting this movie to me as fast as you did, it's a great movie,
It is a good movie worth watching.

Enjoyable movie, thought it was presented more as a pilot for a television series than actually a movie since there was not an actual ending to the story plot. Loved Hal Holbrook, thought Osterhage did a credible job as the movie hero while Robert Davi as the bad guy was definitely a plus. Keir Dullea was a disappointment as Custer, Hollywood continues with the primping, eliteness of Custer as a disappointing hero instead of the courageous, fearless but faulty military leader who would not recognize defeat until it consumed him later in his campaign against plains Indians.
